wikipedia_page.main: Anthony Alfred Harmsworth Marlowe,  (25 October 1904 – 8 September 1965) was a British barrister and politician, who served as a Member of Parliament (MP) for 24 years.

response: In December 1945 Baxter was part of the large Conservative dissent from the proposed Anglo-American loan agreement. He opposed European integration, and in 1948 was one of eight Conservatives to vote against Marshall Aid (with Max Aitken, Eric Gandar Dower, Harry Legge-Bourke, Anthony Marlowe, Arthur Marsden and Sir John Mellor).
The by-election was caused by the resignation of Conservative MP Anthony Marlowe. Marlowe had had a heart attack in June 1965. He had been MP here since winning the seat in 1950.

The Brighton by-election of 1941 was held on 15 November 1941.  The by-election was held due to the resignation of the incumbent Conservative MP, Lord Erskine.  It was won by the Conservative candidate Anthony Marlowe, who was unopposed.
